timeline.message: Rough in model for Golden Record.
added new fields to EmpiLink to provide more information about how the link was created
add logging to check an edge case

timeline.bodyText: rename variable to theMatchOutcome to match type
timeline.author: tadgh

timeline.bodyText: Any particular reason to rework this? Seems odd to have a wrapped class for a list. For the helper functions on it?
timeline.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: There are places where we need to know if this is an EID CandidateList.  For debugging I found it really helpful to know the type of CandidateList it is--we now have the enum with the type in it.  But also as a general rule, I find as soon as a list becomes a thing, it's almost always beneficial to wrap it in a class, if for no other reason than you control how that list is managed.
replies.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText: wait, EID_POSSIBLE_MATCH ? How can an EID be a possible match, or am I misunderstanding something here?
timeline.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: It's a thing.  If you look at how we got there you'll see the path.  I think it happens when one Patient matches two Persons both via EID because of a strange EID update.
replies.author: fil512

timeline.author: tadgh

timeline.bodyText: These could all do with docs indicating in what scenarios these would be used. e.g EID is used when a match occurs strictly due to an externally assigned EID, or something like that.
timeline.author: tadgh
tadgh

timeline.bodyText: A Javadoc explaining the purpose of this class would be nice
timeline.author: tadgh
